translated: â€œWhat is a staff? What is a loincloth?ğŸ”½What is an umbrella? What are sandals?
What is a goad? What is a bowl?

â€œFor twelve yearsğŸ”½I have lived in your presence,
I do not recall being called out to
by a tawny-colored one.
This one, however, is proud and roars,

â€œThis fault has been committed,
as you say, brahmin;
I have even more confidence in you,
stay, brahmin, do not go.â€
â€œBefore I was all white,
from that I became strong;
Now I am all red,
it is time for me to leave.
Before I was inside,
then in the middle, then outside;
Before I am expelled,
I will leave on my own.
One should not associate with one without faith,
like a well with stagnant water;
Even if one digs it up,
Smelling like the mud of water.
One should serve only the contented,
avoid the discontented;
One should attend on the contented,
like one needing water, a well.
One should associate with a man who associates,
not with one who does not associate.
That is the way of the bad person,
he who does not associate with one who associates.
He who does not associate with one who associates,
does not serve one who serves;
He is a human cur,
like a deer caught in a snare.
Through too frequent visits,
and through not visiting at all;
Through this friends deteriorate,
and through begging at the wrong time.
Therefore one should not visit too frequently,
nor visit too long;
One should beg at the right time,
thus friends are not lost.
Through living too long together,
one who is dear becomes not dear;
We will go away, we will go away,

â€œIf we live like this,

or even if it does what should be done;
if it is unwilling and unable to do what should be done,
how can it be tainted by evil?
